Jonny Lee Miller, Justine Waddell, Colleen Ann Fitzpatrick, Jennifer Esposito, Danny Masterson, Jeri Ryan, Lochlyn Munro, Sean Patrick Thomas.

programme.title: The Captive
programme.desc: A father searches for his kidnapped daughter after new evidence suggests that she is still alive. Although years have passed since she disappeared, the revelation that she's being held in captivity offers hope for her safe return.

programme.title: The Sea of Trees
programme.desc: A depressed American businessman makes a pilgrimage to Aokigahara, Japan's notorious "Sucide Forest," with intentions to kill himself. But a chance encounter with a badly injured Japanese man awakens the desire to live within both of them. As they partner together to struggle their way out of the dense forest, they slowly open up about the traumas that brought them there.

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Powerhouse performances by Leonardo DiCaprio and Russell Crowe ignite this charged international-espionage thriller. DiCaprio's a dedicated CIA field operative in Jordan on the trail of a terrorist, and Crowe is a manipulative stateside agent aiding him in his quest. DiCaprio tries to lure the bomber out of hiding, but discovers that the deeper in he gets, the harder it may be to get out alive. Directed by Ridley Scott from a script by William Monahan, who adapted David Ignatius's book.

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: This award-winning black comedy from the Coen brothers involves the plight of a debt-ridden salesman (William H. Macy) who arranges his own wife's kidnapping and the subsequent probe led by pregnant Sheriff Gunderson (Best Actress Frances McDormand). Steve Buscemi, Peter Stormare.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: A rollicking adventure about a mail-room clerk who finds himself shipwrecked on an island inhabited by a minuscule race of people, who make him look like a giant by comparison.

programme.title: Hot Summer Nights

programme.title: Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence returns as FBI agent Malcolm Turner in this gut-busting installment in the "Big Momma's House" series, in which Turner's cross-dressing alter ego, Big Momma, heads to an all-female school with his nephew in order to hunt down a murderer.

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: In this hysterical comedy, two mild-mannered cousins search for a beloved pet kitten after the feline is taken during a home burglary. However, they get in over their heads when their quest leads them to infiltrate a violent street gang by posing as drug dealers.

programme.title: Get Hard

programme.title: Youth

programme.desc: A high-school senior prom is saved by Leslie and the parks crew. As they help organize the event, Leslie and Ron compete to hire a soon-to-be graduate, April reluctantly agrees to go with Andy as his date, and Tom lets Ben help with DJ duties.

programme.desc: Leslie and Andy battle the flu while trying to book performers for the Unity Concert; Tom searches for a sommelier for his new restaurant at a wine competition; and Ben seeks Ron's help with a personal matter.

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: In Part 1 of the two-part Season 6 finale, Leslie makes a huge decision about her future while working with the Parks Department to put on the Unity Concert. Meanwhile, Tom opens the doors to his restaurant; Ron has another encounter with Tammy 2; and Andy gets to live out a rock-and-roll fantasy.

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part Season 6 finale, Leslie makes a huge decision about her future while working with the Parks Department to put on the Unity Concert. Meanwhile, Tom opens the doors to his restaurant; Ron has another encounter with Tammy 2; and Andy gets to live out a rock-and-roll fantasy.

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: In the Season 7 premiere, Leslie enters into a competition with the tech company Gryzzl for a large parcel of land, which she wants to turn into a national park. Meanwhile, April and Andy try to become more spontaneous; and Ben is honored with a speech by Tom at a Bicentennial Gala.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Halloween becomes more frightful as Michael agonizes over an order to fire someone before day's end. Creed: Creed Bratton. Devon: Devon Abner. Toby: Paul Lieberstein. Meredith: Kate Flannery.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: After Dwight karate punches Michael, Jim sets up a lunchtime rematch at Dwight's dojo, where Pam becomes annoyed by Jim's friendliness.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Michael is a surprising asset in helping Jan woo a client. But while he's out, staffers find and act out his screenplay.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Michael convenes with his employees for their performance reviews, but he's much more concerned about his own boss's review of him. Meanwhile, the gang plays along when Dwight thinks it's Friday instead of Thursday.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Big Brother invades the office when Michael gains access to his employees' e-mails and begins spying on their correspondence. Also, Michael's ego is bruised when he's not invited to an afterwork party; and Pam suspects that love is blooming between Dwight and Angela.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: There aren't a lot of ha-ha-has with the ho-ho-hos at the office Christmas party after Michael suggests swapping secret Santa gifts. Michael then tries to lift spirits by introducing spirits---namely, vodka shots. Meanwhile, Jim gives Pam a sweet present.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Michael tries to motivate his office crew by taking them on a harbor cruise. But there isn't any love on this boat, as Michael makes waves and is ultimately thrown in the brig. Elsewhere, Jim's spirits sink when Pam finally sets her wedding date.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Michael tries to get extra sympathy from his staff after he burns his foot on a portable cooking grill. Dwight emerges as the primary caregiver---to Michael's chagrin.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Worried that Michael knows that he secretly pines for Pam, Jim begrudgingly hangs out with his ego-inflated boss in an effort to keep him from spilling the beans. One of their manly outings: a trip to Hooters.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Michael questions the loyalty of his staffers when someone defiles his carpet, so he then tries to bond with them by relocating to Jim's desk in the main office area. This forces Jim to move next to the blabbering Kelly---and farther away from Pam.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Jan (Melora Hardin) assembles the female staffers and presents them with a "women in the workplace" seminar. Not to be outdone, Michael hustles the Dunder Mifflin boys to the warehouse for some male bonding.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Michael takes a bite out of the Big Apple when he heads to corporate headquarters in New York City for a meeting with Jan (Melora Hardin) on Valentine's Day. But he may be biting off more than he can chew, for he and Jan are in for a big surprise. Back at the office, Pam hopes for a holiday gift---something, anything---from her fiancé. Conan O'Brien has a blink-or-you'll-miss-it cameo.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Dwight wins an award for top salesman of the year, but has to conquer his fear of public speaking when he must give a speech at a big Northeast Sales Association convention. And he turns to the worst possible person for help---Michael. Meanwhile, Pam makes plans for her wedding at the office, prompting a downcast Jim to plan a vacation; and the staffers battle over the thermostat for control of the office temperature.

programme.title: The Office
programme.sub-title: Take Your Daughter to Work Day
programme.desc: It's Take Your Daughter to Work Day at Dunder Mifflin, and Michael, who's uncomfortable around kids, is pleasantly surprised when he becomes a hit with them. He tries to impress his new pint-sized posse by showing them a video of him as a "child star" on a local kids' show---but, like all things Michael, it backfires. Meanwhile, Pam's goal is to find just one child who likes her; and Stanley's flirtatious daughter develops a crush on Ryan.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: It's Michael's birthday (which he proudly shares with actress Eva Longoria), but nobody in the office seems to care---except for Dwight. Meanwhile, Kevin waits to hear from his doctor about whether or not he has cancer. This upsets the staffers, but none more so than Michael, who sees the medical crisis taking attention away from his special day.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: When half a joint is found on company property, Dwight dons his Lackawanna County volunteer deputy sheriff's uniform (complete with badge) and launches an investigation. He brings in a professional drug tester---a turn of events that makes Michael nervous. Meanwhile, Jim and Pam play a game in which Jim is forbidden to speak.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: Michael's highfalutin attempts to resolve conflicts in the office only serve to stir up petty differences and forgotten arguments among his employees, causing bedlam and tumult at Dunder Mifflin. Also, the workers get their ID photos taken; and (some) staffers receive Pam's save-the-date notices for her wedding.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: The Dunder Mifflin warehouse is converted into a full-blown gambling hall for the Scranton Business Park's casino night. But things get dicey for Michael when he ends up with two dates for the event, or, in his words, "two queens." Meanwhile, Pam searches for a band for her wedding, and even considers hiring Kevin's Police tribute band, Scrantonicity. Steve Carell wrote the script.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: A sensitivity firestorm ensues when Michael heedlessly outs a gay Dunder Mifflin employee. Meanwhile, some details about Jim and Pam's complicated relationship come to light.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: With Dwight in tow, Michael heads to Philadelphia for an important office-supply convention. After meeting with Jan, Michael plans to spread brotherly love by having a party in his room for fellow conventioneers. Meanwhile, Ryan goes out on a double date---with none other than gabby Kelly.

programme.title: The Office
programme.desc: An office power play ensues when ultraserious Angela, offended by Michael's various antics and his inefficient leadership, leans heavily on Dwight to make a push for Michael's job. Meanwhile, Pam puts on a lunchtime fashion show; and Jim's attempts to play a video game turn deadly---in a virtual sense.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: Counting down the most devastating submission experts in UFC history. Fighters like Joe Lauzon, Fabricio Werdum and other superstars have fans thinking tapout each time they enter the octagon. UFC legends examine their lasting impression on the sport.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Whittaker vs. Aliskerov
programme.desc: Aussie Robert Whittaker meets Russia's Ikram Aliskerov in the middleweight (185 lbs.) main event of an MMA card in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Also: Pavlovich-Volkov (heavy.); Gastelum-Rodriguez (170); Naimov-Baghdasaryan (158); and Walker-Oezdemir (205).

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Butch Reynolds was one of the biggest track and field stars in the world, a talent in his prime on top of his sport. But when he took a drug test in Monaco in the summer of 1990, his career was upended, and his life was forever changed. Yet then and now, the facts of the case shed more than considerable doubt on what happened – instead revealing the tale of a man falsely accused and still compelled in many ways to fight to clear his name all these years later.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.sub-title: I'm Just Here for the Riot
programme.desc: Chronicling the aftermath of the June 15, 2011, riots in Vancouver following the Canucks' Game 7 Stanley Cup Final loss to the Boston Bruins. Police cars were burned, windows shattered, stores were looted, and waves of young people were caught up in the mayhem. The event was captured on hundreds of cell phone cameras; the rioters were outed, shamed, and saw their lives altered forever. Directed by Kathleen Jayme and Asia Youngman.

programme.desc: Chronicling baseball's 1977 and '78 World Series between New York and L.A., and a rivalry filled with colorful characters, seismic controversies and unforgettable moments. Interviews include Reggie Jackson, Dusty Baker, Ron Guidry, Steve Garvey and more. Directed by Fritz Mitchell and narrated by Rob Lowe.

programme.title: Southern Hoops: A History of SEC Basketball
programme.desc: Adolph Rupp came to the University of Kentucky in 1930 – a 29-year-old who took classes at Kansas from James Naismith, the inventor of basketball. Two years later, the SEC was formed, and Rupp's Wildcats would dominate play in the conference for decades. Meanwhile, a future coaching legend was born in Clarksville, Tenn. It was years before Pat Summitt became a household name, but the early years of her journey foretold extraordinary promise.

programme.title: Southern Hoops: A History of SEC Basketball
programme.desc: As the South was transformed by the civil rights movement in the 1960s, so too was the SEC. Texas Western's historic win with an all-Black starting five over Coach Rupp's all-white Kentucky Wildcats in the 1966 NCAA final marked a turning point for basketball in the SEC. Vanderbilt's Perry Wallace then became the conference's first Black player, leading the way for pioneers who would travel a hard road to history. In 1970, another SEC basketball figure in Dawn Staley was born in Philadelphia.

programme.title: Southern Hoops: A History of SEC Basketball
programme.sub-title: Part Three: Changing of the Guard, 1971-1979
programme.desc: The 1970s delivered a new generation of groundbreaking fixtures to the SEC. Dale Brown brought an infectious personality & ferocious competitiveness to LSU men's basketball. In 1974, the incomparable Pat Summitt began her legendary coaching career at Tennessee at the age of just 22. Meanwhile, the year after the death of Coach Rupp in 1977, his successor Joe B. Hall and a pair of local Lexington stars led the Kentucky Wildcats team to a memorable national title, the program's first in 20 years.

programme.title: College Football
programme.sub-title: North Dakota State at South Dakota
programme.desc: North Dakota State (10-3) at South Dakota (10-2) in an NCAA FCS quarterfinal playoff game. Coach Matt Entz's visiting Bison, nine-time FCS champs in the last 12 seasons, look to avenge a 24-19 home loss to South Dakota on Sept. 30. Coyotes WR Carter Bell had first-half TD catches of 50 and 52 yards to help his team to a 21-3 halftime lead. This is their first quarterfinal berth at this level.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Montana (13-1) vs. South Dakota State (14-0) in the NCAA FCS Championship Game. From Toyota Stadium in Frisco, Texas. Coach John Stiegelmeier defending-champion Jackrabbits of SDSU are riding a 31-game winning streak, outscoring three playoff foes by 123-12. Montana overcame snow and two overtime games for their shot at a first title in 22 years. Alex Gronowski QBs the "Jacks" while tackle Alex Gubner heads the Grizzlies' defense.

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: Thrilling special effects highlight Mimi Leder's tale of a massive comet headed for Earth. An ambitious journalist (Tea Leoni), investigating what she believes is a Washington sex scandal, discovers that a comet is going to hit Earth. While a team of scientists struggles to alter its course, families prepare for the end. Robert Duvall, Vanessa Redgrave, Morgan Freeman, Leelee Sobieski.

programme.title: Super 8
programme.desc: Kyle Chandler stars in this riveting sci-fi adventure set in a small Ohio town during the summer of 1979. A group of kids witness a train being derailed while filming an amateur movie, and soon an otherworldly force begins to stalk their town as people mysteriously disappear. Directed by J.J. Abrams and produced by Steven Spielberg.

programme.title: Magnolia
programme.desc: In this audacious ensemble drama about the intersecting lives of troubled Californians, a dying mogul tries to reunite with his motivational-speaker son, a young quiz-show winner deals with his father's abuse and a drug addict falls for a lonely cop.

programme.title: Big Night
programme.desc: In a last-ditch effort to save their foundering Italian restaurant, two immigrant brothers put up every penny they have to stage a publicity event, eventually turning to a business competitor with showbiz connections. Stanley Tucci, Tony Shalhoub, Minnie Driver, Isabella Rossellini, Ian Holm, Marc Anthony, Allison Janney.

programme.title: The Baxter
programme.desc: Michael Showalter wrote, directed and stars in this charming and quirky romantic comedy about the unlikely affair between a nerdy accountant and a beautiful magazine editor (Elizabeth Banks). Michelle Williams, Justin Theroux, Zak Orth, Michael Ian Black.

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: A gubernatorial candidate hires a campaign worker to keep his imbecilic brother out of trouble.

programme.title: Almost Famous
programme.desc: This spirited semiautobiography rocks! Writer-director Cameron Crowe, who wrote for Rolling Stone as a 15-year-old, charts a teen's coming of age around the Age of Aquarius. Patrick Fugit is wonderful as the young incarnation of Crowe, who learns all about life, love, sex, drugs and especially rock and roll while touring with a rising band. Kate Hudson, Billy Crudup, Frances McDormand.

programme.title: Joy Ride
programme.desc: Paul Walker and Steve Zahn star in this well-paced thriller as two brothers whose road trip goes terribly awry. When a seemingly harmless prank backfires, the siblings become the prey of a psychotic truck driver on a highway to hell. Leelee Sobieski, Jessica Bowman, Brian Leckner, Jim Beaver. John Dahl "(Red Rock West") directed.

programme.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
programme.desc: A social-climbing psychopath insinuates himself into a wealthy man's life. Chilling.

programme.title: Catch and Release
programme.desc: After the accidental death of her fiancé, a woman (Jennifer Garner) learns some surprising secrets about him while falling for one of his best friends. "Erin Brockovich" writer Susannah Grant makes her directing debut with this romantic dramedy. Timothy Olyphant, Sam Jaeger, Kevin Smith.

programme.title: Shall We Dance?
programme.desc: Richard Gere, Jennifer Lopez and Susan Sarandon dazzle in this feel-good romantic comedy. Gere plays family man John Clark, a workaholic Chicago lawyer who overcomes his midlife crisis by taking ballroom-dancing lessons. Clark quickly bonds with an attractive instructor (Lopez) and passionately trains for a dance competition. In the meantime, Clark's wife (Sarandon) suspects an affair.

programme.title: Pretty in Pink
programme.desc: Molly Ringwald is an underprivileged Cinderella choosing between two prom princes: a charming preppy and a disarming buddy.

programme.title: Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
programme.desc: A likable cast and a fun premise make this a must-see movie. Mira Sorvino and Lisa Kudrow star as ditsy blondes en route to their class reunion. They're determined to impress their classmates and scramble to play the part of sophisticated businesswomen. But one classmate knows the truth and threatens to expose the two for who they really are. Janeane Garofalo, Alan Cumming.

programme.title: Empire Records
programme.desc: An erratic day in the life of an independent record store's colorful teen staff and their misadventures as they learn their store has been purchased by a large chain.

programme.title: B.A.P.S.
programme.desc: Two Black American Princesses (Halle Berry, Natalie Desselle) go to L.A. to audition for a music video. They don't get the part, but a scheming man offers one of them big bucks to impersonate his wealthy uncle's lover in a plot to become his sole heir. Martin Landau, Ian Richardson, Troy Beyer. Director: Robert Townsend.

programme.title: The Wood
programme.desc: Three black friends gather for a wedding, and recall their teen years growing up in 1980s Inglewood, Cal., after the groom gets cold feet and starts thinking about his high-school sweetheart. A touching and nostalgic coming-of-age tale.

programme.title: Lucky Them
programme.desc: A Seattle rock journalist searches for her ex-boyfriend, a onetime music superstar who went missing and possibly committed suicide. With the help of a wannabe documentary filmmaker, she sets out to uncover the truth in this offbeat comedy-drama.

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Jim Carrey's vibrant turn ignites this highly imaginative, dark-humored fantasy. Three plucky orphans are sent to live with a distant relative---the dastardly and greedy Count Olaf, who plots to steal the children's considerable inheritance. Based on Daniel Handler's books, the film won an Oscar for Best Makeup and features narration by Jude Law.

programme.title: Bandslam
programme.desc: This rollicking coming-of-age film stars Vanessa Hudgens ("High School Musical") as a social misfit who teams up with a popular girl to form a rock band for their high school's battle-of-the-bands contest. Alyson Michalka, Lisa Kudrow, Gaelan Connell.

programme.title: Kinky Boots
programme.desc: Inspired by true events, this charming and funny romp shows what happens when an outrageous female impersonator (Chiwetel Ejiofor) helps an uptight Englishman (Joel Edgerton) save his failing shoe company by designing fetish footwear. Sarah-Jane Potts, Ewan Hooper. Directed by Julian Jarrold.

programme.title: The Evening Star
programme.desc: In this sequel to the award-winning classic 'Terms of Endearment,' Aurora Greenaway tries to pick up the pieces after her daughter's death and find renewed strength and love while struggling to raise her rebellious grandchildren. Shirley MacLaine, Bill Paxton, Juliette Lewis, Miranda Richardson, Ben Johnson, Scott Wolf, George Newbern, Marion Ross, Mackenzie Astin, Donald Moffat, China Kantner.

programme.title: Game 6
programme.desc: Disappointing tale set during the 1986 World Series follows a playwright and Boston Red Sox fan (Michael Keaton) as he sweats out the opening of his new play. Robert Downey Jr., Catherine O'Hara, Griffin Dunne. Directed by Michael Hoffman from a script by popular novelist Don DeLillo (his first screenplay).

programme.title: Bobby
programme.desc: Emilio Estevez wrote, directed and costars in this powerful, behind-the-scenes look at the events leading up to the 1968 assassination of Sen. Robert F. Kennedy at the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles. The superb ensemble cast includes Anthony Hopkins, Laurence Fishburne, Harry Belafonte, Joy Bryant, Nick Cannon, Heather Graham, Helen Hunt, William H. Macy, Sharon Stone and others.

programme.title: John Grisham's 'The Rainmaker'
programme.desc: In this gripping adaptation, a naive young lawyer and his experienced partner take on a corrupt insurance company in the court case of a lifetime.

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: A bank robbery in Brooklyn goes wrong and evolves into a protracted hostage situation, turning the plan's mastermind into a media celebrity and the event into a media circus. Based on a true story.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri is loading up on tropical flavor, starting in a Florida spot serving up lobster enchiladas and lionfish rolls. Then, in Hawaii, a funky food truck is cooking Vietnamese specialties like the bomb banh mi sandwiches and standout spring rolls.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy Fieri's checking out joints putting their own spin on global flavor.

programme.title: Guy's All-American Road Trip
programme.desc: On their epic journey through the American West, Guy Fieri and his family try Wyoming-style pizza and made-to-order chuckwagon steaks. Then they go to the Buffalo Bill Center of the West, and a trip to a sausage factory turns into a campsite brawl.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Green chili and mile-high burgers are found in Fort Collins, Colo. Also: Guy visits a breakfast-lunch café in Falmouth, Mass., known for its pickle chips and savory scone sandwich; and travels to a family-owned restaurant for soft-shell crab and kale soup.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Meat dishes are highlighted, beginning with a Jamaican joint in Colorado Springs known for curried goat and jerk chicken. Later, a funky beer bar in Baltimore serves wild boar sliders and pork belly mac and cheese fries; and in Washington, D.C., Guy visits a deli carving up homemade pastrami and a meat-filled Moroccan specialty.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy explores the cuisine of Barcelona, Spain. Featured: Galician-style octopus and soup; traditional sausage and sauces from a grab-and-go sandwich stop; and old-school Catalan cooking, including rabbit and snail specialties.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy travels to Phoenix where an unusual joint makes barbecue fries and puts a new spin on chilaquiles. In Boulder, a pizza place loads up the pies and their meatball grinder. Later, a Dallas spot cranks out different kinds of chicken.

programme.title: Guy's All-American Road Trip

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.sub-title: Triple D Nation: Fishin' in Flavortown
programme.desc: Guy Fieri goes fishing at Flavortown faves. Guy returns to a Puerto Rican spot in Orlando, FL, servin' up Caribbean seafood. Then, in Rhode Island, a Cranston bistro puts out killer cod, while a Narragansett café fires up next-level burgers.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy Fieri's picking up handfuls of flavor. In Boise, Idaho, an empanada emporium and a stick-to-your-ribs spot are both serving up off-the-hook sandwiches. Then, a funky joint in Savannah is putting out real deal wood-fired pizza and bagels.

programme.desc: Join Cindy Crawford and Ellen Pompeo as they discuss their lives and the breakthrough skin care discovery that keeps them looking their best. Take a trip to the stunning French countryside to see the rare French melon that defies the aging process.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea Brown forgoes the expensive restaurant with a fun date night in. She and her boo invite their favorite couples over for a delicious dinner of braised chicken with onion gravy; maple-roasted root vegetables; a hot toddy; and fried rice pudding balls.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea Brown brings her guests over for a light and hearty take on a classic Southern oyster roast. Roasted Oysters with Thai Chili Mignonette, Crab Rangoon Wonton Cups, Easy Brunswick Stew, and Slow Cooker Black Cherry Cobbler are among the dishes she prepares.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: The Kitchen gets inventive as they highlight standout meals. Geoffrey Zakarian sticks to tradition with Chicken Saltimbocca, Katie Lee Biegel adds greens to her Summer Vegetable Pasta, and Sunny Anderson creates some festive Summer Spritzer Globes.

programme.title: Girl Meets Farm
programme.desc: It's the end of beet season, and Molly Yeh has tons of food for the farmers. She whips up her Chorizo and Tot Breakfast Burritos, Giant Sausage Pasta and a Shaved Fennel Salad. For dessert, she serves a Beet Red-ish Velvet Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting.

programme.title: Girl Meets Farm
programme.desc: It's time for wheat harvest on the farm and Molly Yeh is making a Mexican food vacation for her husband, Nick, with all his favorites. She cooks up a decadent refried beans and rice bowl, as well as roasted salmon tacos wrapped in chewy homemade flour tortillas.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes fast and easy dishes. There's shortcut Gussied Up Ramen followed by an effortless One Pot Clam Spaghetti. Next, favorites come together in Caprese Avocado Toast, and standby meets speedy in Tex-Mex Pantry Gnocchi Soup.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond gives classic dishes a lighter spin, starting with spice-rubbed Grilled Cauliflower Steaks and fully loaded Lightened Up Nachos. She also makes a platter of Mushroom "Cheesesteak" Lettuce Wraps and Garlic Mashed Potatoes.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: The hosts share time-saving tips and slow-cooker recipes for the holiday season. Included: Katie uses Thanksgiving leftovers for a turkey gumbo; and later, she and Geoffrey master the perfect cup of brew at a local coffee shop. Also: Marcela makes enchiladas suizas.

programme.title: Symon's Dinners Cooking Out
programme.desc: Michael Symon pays tribute to Southern culinary heritage, courtesy of his mother-in-law, Sherla. First, he indulges in the comfort of Sherla's fried chicken and fried okra. For dessert, Michael and Liz savor Frozen Peaches and Cream, a summery treat.

programme.title: Symon's Dinners Cooking Out
programme.desc: Michael Symon pays tribute to his grandfather and crowns Pastrami Spiced Pork Chops with Braised Vegetables, the epitome of a home cooked meal. Then, Michael tops Deviled Eggs with pickled mustard seeds and chives, and Liz makes the perfect Godfather Cocktail with a combination of scotch and amaretto.

programme.title: Outchef'd
programme.desc: Home cook Jen McNabb knows something's fishy when Eddie Jackson challenges her to a halibut face-off against the world-famous Chef Rocco DeSpirito. Jen needs just one vote from the panel of New York City judges to take home the $5,000 prize!

programme.title: Outchef'd
programme.desc: Software consultant Tommy Ranucci gets the chance to face off against his childhood hero, Chef Andrew Zimmern. After they duke it out with wild grains, a panel of New York City judges will decide if Tommy goes home with the $5,000 prize.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy Fieri hosts a bodacious burger duel with four baller burgermeisters. They must create an over-the-top cheeseburger with 10 or fewer ingredients before combining alternate ground beef and unique produce items into their winning burger and fries.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: It's burger night in Flavortown Market, and four chefs who specialize in making baller burgers are going head-to-head to find out which burger expert reigns supreme. Guy Fieri starts things off strong by having the chefs make a double burger, but they have to get creative because all the burger buns in Flavortown Market are out of stock! Then the chefs go all out to make an epic loaded spicy burger -- plus a shake to cool the judges down.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Four chefs come to Flavortown to compete in three chicken-themed rounds to prove their poultry prowess. Guy challenges the chefs with making a fried chicken combo on a $17 budget.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Four talented, up-and-coming chefs incorporate afterschool snacks into two rounds of GGG hijinks.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy Fieri has lots of offers to welcome four chefs to Flavortown Market, including red light specials in all ten aisles. Using the red light specialties, the cooks must prepare a fried feast before preparing a pig dish with 11 or fewer components.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits some small towns with big flavor. Included: a roadside bar in Parkland, Wis., featuring sandwiches stuffed with brisket and crispy pork belly; an organic spot in Jackson, Wyo., serving ethnic-inspired eats like the Asian bison bowl and Thai curry soup; and a monster burger and a unique twist on pizza found in Lancaster, Ore.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Highlights of a trip to Key West, Fla., include a shack that serves New England seafood; a husband and wife who make memorable fish tacos; and a tiny food cart specializing in Caribbean-Asian recipes.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy travels west for barbecue. Included: homemade chorizo and a Yucatan turkey special served at a food court gem in Los Angeles. Also: two funky grill joints in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Cuisine from three different continents is highlighted during Guy's travels. Included: He eats Indian curry and Brazilian croquettes and seafood in Denver. Also: meat sandwiches in Atlanta.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri tries restaurants with inventive dishes.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri digs into regional flavors where one may not expect to find them, like Cajun jambalaya in Bend, OR, and Pakistani oxtail in Chehalis, WA. Plus, a tiki joint in Houston serves elevated dumplings and honey butter chicken biscuits.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy Fieri's digging into some winning chicken dinners. In Maui, Hawaii, it's a star-studded stop at Mick Fleetwood's joint serving the rocker's mom's favorite chicken, plus a dish that musician Sammy Hagar dives right into. Then, a Hawaiian-Thai food truck stuffin' their wings and fryin' their ribs to perfection. And in Palm Springs, a hot dog spot going meatless with their chili dog and putting a big twist on chicken and waffles.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: International flavors are highlighted, beginning in Key Largo, Fla., where Guy visits an Italian spot known for its outrageous veal and hearty truffle mac and cheese. Also: A funky food truck in Stockton, Cal., offers a taste of Southeast Asia with its homemade rice noodle soup; and a neighborhood San Francisco joint serves Puerto Rican and Cuban fare.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri samples standout sandwiches and some serious spice. Included: a primo pork burger and cauliflower in Longmont, Colorado; Italian beef and real deal gyros in Columbus, Ohio; and fiery Thai specialties in Los Angeles, California.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy highlights some meaty favorites. First, in Louisville, he visits an Irish pub serving up cottage pie and a lamb-cabbage specialty. Then, in Charlotte, he tastes Asian-barbecue fusion. Finally, he stops at a burger joint known for creative toppings, including sweet potato, Brie and house-made pimento cheese.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is all about fast and fabulous party food for easy entertaining. She prepares delicious Herby Mediterranean Meatballs, an incredible Cajun Shrimp Cocktail, spicy Jalapeno Cheeseburger Wontons and sophisticated Rum Balls.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares budget-friendly dishes for entertaining.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond cooks up make-ahead savory, sweet and sippable marvels for brunch parties. There's a fabulous French Onion Frittata, a one-pan Lemon Blueberry French Toast Casserole, lovable Sweet Glazed Cherry Almond Rolls and a spicy Tex-Mex Bloody Mary.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea Brown hosts an end-of-summer BBQ on the porch with a menu of Steak Burgers with Hot Pepper Bacon Jam and Beer Cheese, Grilled Corn with Garlic Butter, Spicy Sausage Baked Beans and Homemade Pineapple Whip with Toasted Coconut and Macadamia Nuts.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea Brown and African American historian Kevin Mitchell debate the significance and impact of Juneteenth over chicken and sausage gumbo, NOLA-style potato salad, marinated watermelon salad, and red velvet Swiss roll with cream cheese frosting.

programme.title: Mary Makes It Easy
programme.desc: Mary's delivering fast food flavors at home with dishes that are simple to make.

programme.title: Mary Makes It Easy
programme.desc: Mary brings recipes and guides to grill for novices.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: The Kitchen hosts dish out their best recipes from the land and sea, perfect for any special occasion! Geoffrey Zakarian brings a fresh Crab Salad in Endive, Sunny Anderson gets herbaceous with Green Goddess Grilled Lobster with Easy Green Goddess Rice and Jeff Mauro adds some spice with Chorizo and Shrimp Tacos. Then, Katie Lee Biegel beaches out with her Catch the Wave Cake, and Michael Symon drops in to talk about "Symon's Dinners Cooking Out" and shares his Grilled Ribeye with Tonnato Sauce.

programme.title: Ciao House
programme.desc: The last four chefs are taken aback when judges Alex Guarnaschelli and Gabe Bertaccini challenge them to produce a three-course dinner with only five items each dish.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Part 1 of 4. Bobby Flay joins the judges' panel as returning champions compete to win the chance to beat chef Bobby. In the first round, a Scandinavian fish and sugary cereal test the competitors. Later, they are given flowery syrup and an onion with sprinkles for their entrée dishes. Finally, desserts are made with a cheesy sandwich, some jelly and one of Bobby's favorite ingredients.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Part 2 of 4. Four returning champs compete for a chance to beat Bobby Flay. Their first challenge involves a seafood that needs tenderizing and a canned product. Then, entrées must include a king of the sea and an icebox cake. Finally, the judges worry how an ice cream made with one of Bobby's favorite ingredients will turn out given that there's trouble with the machine.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Part 3 of 4. A set of twins compete for the chance to beat Bobby Flay. Round 1 features a cold soup and stuffed lobster. Then, entrée ingredients include a giant piece of meat and some tasty little dried fruits. Finally, the remaining two chefs need to figure out what to do with a Swedish cookie that's difficult to pronounce.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Conclusion. Three undefeated champs are challenged with making appetizers with a strange sauce. Later, an extremely difficult entrée round stands between one chef and the chance to beat Bobby Flay and take home $40,000.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia.

programme.desc: In this winning comedy, the carefree life of a superstar bachelor quarterback (Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson) is disrupted when he discovers that he has an 8-year-old daughter (Madison Pettis). She turns up on his doorstep and soon he's scrambling to fit his football career in with her ballet lessons and other girly pastimes. Johnson and Pettis display a most engaging chemistry. Kyra Sedgwick is a blast as his high-powered and high-strung agent. Directed by Andy Fickman.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Golf
programme.desc: Dick's Open first-round play from En-Joie GC in Endicott, N.Y. Padraig Harrington repeated as champion last year on this course that hosted a PGA Tour event from 1971-2005. Joe Durant and Ernie Els finished second and third. Harrington is 17th in the 2024 standings, topped by Stephen Ames.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: Second-round play in the 70th KPMG Women's PGA Championship, third of five LPGA majors this year, from Sahalee CC in Sammamish, Wash. Only the top 60 players (and ties) advance to the third round and final round. China's Ruoning Yin edged Yuka Saso by a shot to win last year. Saso and Nelly Korda captured this year's first two majors.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: KLM Open third-round play from The International in Amsterdam, Netherlands. This tournament dates back to 1912 (as the Dutch Open) and is an original event from the European Tour's launch in 1972. Pablo Larrazabal beat fellow Spaniard Adrian Otaegui by two shots last year.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: Travelers Championship third-round play from TPC River Highlands in Cromwell, Conn. This now-$20 million signature event dates back to 1952 and bore the name of entertainer Sammy Davis Jr. from 1973-88. No cut is made for the exclusive 77-player field.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Golf
programme.desc: Dick's Open second-round play from En-Joie GC in Endicott, N.Y. Padraig Harrington repeated as champion last year on this course that hosted a PGA Tour event from 1971-2005. Joe Durant and Ernie Els finished second and third. Harrington is 17th in the 2024 standings, topped by Stephen Ames.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: Third-round play in the 70th KPMG Women's PGA Championship, third of five LPGA majors this year, from Sahalee CC in Sammamish, Wash. The purse is up to $10 million for this event, held on a course that also hosted this event in 2016 (won by 18-year-old Brooke Henderson), as well as the 1998 men's PGA (Steve Stricker) and 2010 U.S. Senior Open (Bernhard Langer).

programme.desc: Travelers Championship final-round play from TPC River Highlands in Cromwell, Conn. Harrington is 17th in the 2024 standings, topped by Stephen Ames.

programme.title: Golf Films
programme.desc: Retelling the story of the 106th Open Championship at Turnberry, the titanic tussle between Jack Nicklaus and Tom Watson, in 1977. The film interweaves rich archival footage with contemporary interviews and animated scenes, chronicling a tournament that helped transform golf from conservative to cool.

programme.title: The Santa Summit
programme.desc: Two people return home to reflect and regroup after personal setbacks and find themselves drawn together when their friend groups work together at their townâ€s annual holiday celebration.

programme.title: My Norwegian Holiday
programme.desc: Dealing with her grandma's death, JJ seeks dissertation inspiration. Henrik, drawn to her troll figurine, invites her to Bergen, Norway, to trace its origins.

Meanwhile, Brock and Van compete to see which one can get the more romantic present for his wife. Brock: Christopher Rich. Van: Steve Howey. Cheyenne: JoAnna Garcia.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Reba is caught in the middle when she must choose sides in a dental dispute between her boss (Dan Castellaneta) and Brock. Also: Cheyenne and Van debate over which of them is the bigger liar and cheat.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Brock's mother pays Reba a visit and tells her Brock may regret leaving her for Barbra Jean (Melissa Peterman). Meanwhile, Cheyenne tries to persuade Van to forgive his parents. Cheyenne: JoAnna Garcia. Van: Steve Howey. Brock: Christopher Rich.

programme.title: Fourth Down and Love
programme.desc: Sparks are reignited when a single mom and a pro football player coincidentally meet again on her daughter's flag football field after his career is derailed by a injury.

programme.title: A Tail of Love
programme.desc: When Bella discovers funding for her dog rescue center is being discontinued, she turns to JR, a caring soldier who not only becomes attached to one of her beloved rescues, but also to her.

programme.title: The Perfect Catch
programme.desc: A woman reinvents her struggling diner when her old high-school boyfriend returns to town as a baseball superstar, and she also revisits the past in order to find a brighter future.

programme.title: Pearl in Paradise
programme.desc: A travel photographer and an author team up to find an elusive Fijian "pearl." As both of their careers hang in the balance, their treasure hunt in a Fijian valley might lead them to find the only treasure that really matters.

programme.title: Two Tickets to Paradise
programme.desc: When two weddings are ruined by both the bride and groom getting left at the altar, they still decide to take their honeymoons, not knowing they are heading to the same resort in Hawaii.

programme.title: Roadhouse Romance
programme.desc: When Callie returns home, she finds her hometown has changed - her first love has a new girl and her family's BBQ restaurant has hit hard times. She clashes with a marooned bigshot director who might hold the key to saving the restaurant.

programme.title: Two Scoops of Italy
programme.desc: When an American chef travels to a quant village in Italy for inspiration, she falls in love with the flavors, culture, gelato, and the Italian gentleman who helps her discover it all.

programme.title: Savoring Paris
programme.desc: Disillusioned with her life, Ella embarks on a soul-searching journey to Paris where she navigates love, self-discovery and cheese amidst the enchanting backdrop of The City of Love.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: After Van (Steve Howey) reconciles with his parents, they send gifts for the baby, causing Reba to feel threatened. Soon, the situation turns into a competition between grandparents. Meanwhile, Cheyenne gets lonely when Van starts playing football again. Dan: Mark Tymchyshyn. Sue: Robin Riker. Reba: Reba McEntire.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Following a burglary scare, Reba suggests that she, Cheyenne and Kyra take a self-defense class. Meanwhile, Brock is shocked by the cost of home-security systems and decides to install one himself. Brock: Christopher Rich. Van: Steve Howey. Kyra: Scarlett Pomers.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: At Jake's school auction, Reba's good intentions backfire when Barbra Jean wins Reba as her personal assistant for the day. Meanwhile, Cheyenne is overcome with jealousy when Van's private football lessons are a hit with the fund-raiser's female bidders.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: In the interest of naming a legal guardian for Elizabeth, Reba persuades Cheyenne and Van to draw up a will. But she soon regrets her insistence when she learns who they have chosen to care for her granddaughter.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Kyra's good grades earn her an invite to study abroad, while Cheyenne's skipped classes land her in summer session. Also: Brock and Barbra Jean buy a new house.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: Reba reels from the news that Kyra has asked to move in with Brock and Barbra Jean, while Van and Cheyenne conspire to make Kyra's room into a nursery for Elizabeth.

programme.title: Reba
programme.sub-title: She's Leaving Home, Bye Bye - Part 1
programme.desc: Part 1 of two. Kyra decides whether she's staying at Reba's or moving next door to Brock and Barbra Jean's place.

programme.title: Reba
programme.sub-title: She's Leaving Home, Bye Bye - Part 2
programme.desc: Conclusion. Kyra decides whether she's staying at Reba's or moving next door to Brock and Barbra Jean's place.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: As Reba's relationship with Kyra improves dramatically, Brock and Barbra Jean find it increasingly difficult to deal with the testy teen.

programme.title: Reba
programme.desc: After Reba's lecture on the gravity of choosing a career, Cheyenne asks Brock for guidance---and decides to become a dentist like her dad.

programme.title: Love Takes Flight
programme.desc: A divorced, single mom is an expert at juggling the demands of her busy life. Between raising her five-year-old daughter and her job as administrator of the town's hospital, she's working at max capacity.

programme.title: Summer Villa
programme.desc: A French villa gets crowded when a writer and a chef both show up with plans to stay there, so they try to share the house as they each work on some personal struggles. In the process, they find something else each was missing in their lives.

programme.title: A Greek Recipe for Romance
programme.desc: After a recent setback, Abby heads to Greece to visit her mom and decide what's next. While there, she meets Theo and they team up to open a restaurant. But will Abby be able to stay?

programme.title: Love on the Right Course
programme.desc: Whitney is a professional golfer who is struggling to make the cut to qualify for her next tournament in Europe. Concerned that she might not be able to continue competing on a professional level, she returns to Budapest, and the golf course her family owns there, to reevaluate her career. She finds that her father, who has grown reclusive since losing his wife two years ago, has handed over day-to-day operations of the club to a laid-back, new golf pro, Daniel.

programme.title: Love, Romance & Chocolate
programme.desc: A food stylist woman decides to take a trip to Belgium by her own after being dumped by her boyfriend.

programme.title: Two Scoops of Italy
programme.desc: When an American chef travels to a quant village in Italy for inspiration, she falls in love with the flavors, culture, gelato, and the Italian gentleman who helps her discover it all.

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: Incredible biopic of Chris Kyle, the most-celebrated sniper in American military history. In the aftermath of 9/11, Kyle decides to serve his country by becoming a Navy SEAL. But with each tour of duty, he grows more detached from his wife and children.

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: This explosive remake of the classic television series details four ex-Special Forces operatives who fight to expose the truth after being framed for a major crime.

programme.title: Fantasmas
programme.desc: After learning about a program that would free his mind from his body, Julio gets a tip on the missing oyster from a bartender, who leads him to the former location of the first gay hamster club and later a middle school.

programme.title: 20th Century Women
programme.desc: In 1979, a single mom and boardinghouse landlord decides that the best way she can parent her teen son is to enlist her young tenants—a quirky punk photographer, a mellow handyman and her son's shrewd but troubled best friend—to serve as his role models in a rapidly changing world.

programme.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
programme.desc: Hugh Jackman once again takes on the role of Wolverine in this thrilling prequel to the "X-Men" movie series. This origin story explains how Wolverine discovered his unique powers and the mysterious circumstances behind his retractable metal claws. Fanboys will cheer at the introduction of many characters made famous in the "X-Men" comics, including Sabretooth.

programme.title: How Do You Measure a Year?
programme.desc: For 17 years, filmmaker Jay Rosenblatt filmed his daughter Ella on her birthday in the same spot, asking her the same questions. In just 29 minutes, we watch her grow from a toddler to a young woman with all the beautiful and sometimes awkward stages in between. Each phase is captured fleetingly but makes an indelible mark. Her responses to her father's questions are just a backdrop for a deeper story of parental love, acceptance, and ultimately, independence.

programme.title: Last Christmas
programme.desc: A dysfunctional young woman working as Santa's elf at a year-round Christmas store in London finds her life taking an unexpectedly optimistic turn after becoming romantically entangled with a handsome and mysterious stranger over the holiday season.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: Living in the perfect Barbieland, Barbie and Ken lead a carefree existence, but soon, Ken finds himself questioning his simple life. Enamored by the human world, he convinces Barbie to leave their comfort zone and take a trip outside Barbieland. Soon, the Mattel CEO feels threatened by the duo's daring decision and pursues them to guide them back to where they belong.

programme.title: Aquaman and The Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: The sequel follows Aquaman as he prepares for another battle against Black Manta. Equipped with the deadly Black Trident, Black Manta is determined to avenge his father's death. With no one by his side, Aquaman seeks the help of his brother Orm, hoping to build a strong alliance that can empower him to defeat Black Manta who vows to kill him at all costs. Aquaman must push himself and overlook the differences he has with his brother to save the world from destruction.

programme.title: True Detective
programme.desc: In Ennis, Alaska, the men that operate a research station vanish. To solve the case.

programme.title: True Detective
programme.desc: Danvers and Prior set out to learn more about Tsalal and find an unlikely location for the physical evidence. Captain Connelly threatens to move the case to Anchorage. Later, Navarro and Danvers separately find a connection between one of the Tsalal men and Annie, prompting the former partners to agree to work the case together.

programme.title: True Detective
programme.desc: While Hank leads the search for Clark, Prior questions Danvers about the murder-suicide case that has strained her relationship with Navarro. After searching through Clark's trailer, Navarro and Danvers ask a local hairdresser for information about Annie, which leads to a tip about another former Tsalal employee. Later, tensions between Danvers and her stepdaughter Leah rise.

programme.title: True Detective
programme.desc: When Julia's mental health struggles resurface, Navarro brings her to a local facility, promising that this time will be better. Later, Danvers and Navarro confirm the location of Annie's murder – and Danvers levies a harsh punishment on Leah following her act of protest.

programme.title: True Detective
programme.desc: Prior investigates the connection between Tsalal and Silver Sky mining company, while Navarro saves Leah from a violent protest. Danvers is warned against further investigation after Connelly shares the cause of the Tsalal men's deaths, and Hank receives a quid pro quo offer.

programme.title: True Detective
programme.desc: During a brutal storm, Danvers and Navarro find themselves stuck at Tsalal with no electricity or means of contact. As the truth about what happened to Annie and the Tsalal men unfolds, Navarro and Danvers each confront the demons from their past.

programme.title: True Detective
programme.desc: During a brutal storm, Danvers and Navarro find themselves stuck at Tsalal with no electricity or means of contact. As the truth about what happened to Annie and the Tsalal men unfolds, Navarro and Danvers each confront the demons from their past.

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, a deskbound CIA analyst is finally given the chance to go undercover in order to save her missing partner and thwart a global disaster in this uproarious comedy.

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn. This gut-busting comedy is a sequel to the 2012 surprise hit.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
Dope
programme.desc: In this kinetic coming-of-age story, a geeky black high schooler hopes to get into an Ivy League college and leave his rough L.A. neighborhood behind. However, his promising future is put in jeopardy when he attends a drug dealer's birthday party and gets caught up in a deal gone wrong.

programme.title: The Secrets We Keep
programme.desc: Maja is peacefully living with her husband Lewis in post-World War II America when one day she meets their next-door neighbor. Immediately, it dawns on her that he was the person who brutalized her and her family during the war. Convinced that she is right, she devises a plan to kidnap him and to make him pay for the heinous crimes he committed against her that brought immense suffering into her life.

programme.title: Southside With You
programme.desc: Touching docudrama about Barack Obama's first date with Michelle Robinson, his future wife, during the summer of 1989 in Chicago.

programme.title: Legally Blondes
programme.desc: Camilla Rosso and Rebecca Rosso star as Elle Woods' British twin cousins in this wildly hilarious spin-off of "Legally Blonde." The girls move to Los Angeles to attend high school, where they quickly learn that in order to succeed they will need to prove that blondes not only have more fun, but have more smarts as well.

programme.title: Poltergeist
programme.desc: A young suburban girl is abducted by spirits that have besieged her family's home in this terrifying remake of the horror classic. Desperate, her parents devise a plan to rescue her from the other side.

programme.title: Date Night
programme.desc: Mild-mannered married couple Phil and Claire steal a dinner reservation, which leads to a case of mistaken identity in this hilarious, action-packed romp. The reservation was for a pair of thieves, and now their lives are in danger. If they can survive a wacky and life-threatening night, they may just rediscover the passion missing from their marriage.

programme.title: The Regime
programme.desc: As Chancellor Elena Vernham prepares for her annual Victory Day celebration, a weary Cpl. Herbert Zubak, arrives at the palace – where he's introduced to his new boss' strict health precautions. After a briefing with her top ministers about a pending cobalt deal with the U.S., Elena reprimands Zubak for following orders a little too closely at her lavish banquet.

programme.title: The Regime
programme.desc: Concerned about Zubak's growing prominence, Nicholas conspires with Laskin, Schiff, and Singer to make Elena dislike the corporal. With the cobalt trade stalled, Elena invites Senator Judith Holt to the palace to reach an accord between their two countries. Later, Agnes avoids Laskin's questions regarding her ailing son's remarkably wonderful health.

programme.title: The Regime
programme.desc: Elena responds to warnings about her new land reform measures and America's growing indifference following Sen. Holt's visit by sending Zubak to replace her at a cabinet meeting. After hosting a birthday party for her late father, Elena launches a controversial military operation...and sends Zubak to the front lines.

programme.title: The Regime
programme.desc: As Zubak learns the location of Keplinger, the chancellor's biggest political rival, Elena attempts to do damage control in the wake of a tragic accident. As public sentiment against her continues to grow, Elena and Nicholas make a rare trip the outside palace walls to meet with factory workers. Meanwhile, Agnes' loyalty is tested by an offer from an unknown source.

programme.title: The Regime
programme.desc: As Christmas approaches, and amid escalating violence, Elena remains determined to not abandon her people, despite being advised to leave the palace. Meanwhile, Schiff, Singer, and Huber imagine a scenario where the increasingly unpredictable chancellor could be removed, and Peter proposes a way for Agnes and her son to get out of the palace to safety, but with a price.

programme.title: The Regime
programme.desc: Elena and Zubak are on the run from the rebels who breached the palace walls; Elena uses her duplicity and diplomacy skills as an effort to stay in power.

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two adult sisters, one an irresponsible single mom and the other a kindhearted nurse, decide to throw one last party at their childhood home before it's sold by their parents. However, their bash ends up going awry in this raunchy and ridiculous comedy.

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Baby
programme.desc: Bridget Jones, now a fortysomething news producer, discovers that she's pregnant in this hilarious comedy sequel. However, she isn't sure if the baby's father is Mark Darcy, her on-and-off boyfriend, or Jack Qwant, her new American love interest.

programme.title: Fantasmas
programme.desc: After learning about a program that would free his mind from his body, Julio gets a tip on the missing oyster from a bartender, who leads him to the former location of the first gay hamster club and later a middle school.

programme.title: Fantasmas
programme.desc: After learning about a program that would free his mind from his body, Julio gets a tip on the missing oyster from a bartender, who leads him to the former location of the first gay hamster club and later a middle school.

programme.title: The Disaster Artist
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy-drama based on actual events, weirdo auteur Tommy Wiseau befriends struggling actor Greg Sestero. Together, they make a movie called "The Room," which soon becomes a cult hit due to its staggering badness.

programme.title: Men
programme.desc: In the aftermath of a personal tragedy, Harper retreats alone to the beautiful English countryside, hoping to find a place to heal. But someone — or something — from the surrounding woods appears to be stalking her, and what begins as simmering dread becomes a fully-formed nightmare, inhabited by her darkest memories and fears.

programme.title: Remember
programme.desc: An elderly Holocaust survivor escapes his nursing home, and embarks on a quest to execute the Nazi commandant who murdered his family. However, his mission is complicated by his advancing Alzheimer's in this stark thriller.

programme.title: Elektra
programme.desc: Reprising her role in "Daredevil," Jennifer Garner gives an electrifying performance in this entertaining Marvel Comic adaptation about an assassin who decides to protect her intended next victims from a band of supernatural ninjas.

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride, a helicopter pilot races to rescue his daughter and estranged wife as a series of massive earthquakes devastate California. Meanwhile, a Cal Tech professor attempts to warn other citizens.

programme.title: The Social Network
programme.desc: In this sweeping tale of Internet success, nerdy, awkward Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the Web site Facebook and becomes a billionaire, but ends up embroiled in legal disputes as the friends who helped him during his rise to the top are now eager to see him fall.

programme.title: Rock Hudson: All That Heaven Allowed
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of actor Rock Hudson, one of Hollywood's most celebrated leading men of the 1950's and '60's and an icon of Hollywood's Golden Age, whose diagnosis and eventual death from AIDS in 1985 shocked the world, subsequently shifting the way the public perceived the AIDS pandemic.

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman and Superman clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world in this soaring comic-book extravaganza. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by Lex Luthor.

programme.title: Fantasmas
programme.desc: After learning about a program that would free his mind from his body, Julio gets a tip on the missing oyster from a bartender, who leads him to the former location of the first gay hamster club and later a middle school.

programme.title: Uncut Gems
programme.desc: A jewelry store owner and dealer to rich and famous clients places a series of high-stakes bets in the hopes of securing a huge windfall. But His lavish spending habits on gambling, and family issues cause him to become behind on his debts. So he devises a clever way to pay off his bookies and finally come out ahead all while protecting his family and business.

programme.title: Stevie Van Zandt: Disciple
programme.desc: Traces Van Zandt's career as a musician, activist and actor from New Jersey to stadiums around the world.

programme.title: Black Swan
programme.desc: Ballet dancer Nina experiences traumatic hallucinations as she pushes her body to the limit in order to win the lead role in a production of "Swan Lake" in this dark, mesmerizing psychological thriller. Meanwhile, she must also deal with competition from a rival dancer and the sexual advances of the ballet company's director.

programme.title: Evil Dead
programme.desc: Five twentysomethings discover the Book of the Dead in a secluded cabin, and unwittingly conjure demons that emerge from the surrounding woods with a hunger for fresh souls in this terrifying remake of the horror classic.

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: In this intriguing dramedy, an investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep.

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this nail-biting adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent.

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective.

programme.title: The Spectacular Now
programme.desc: A smooth-talking high-school senior falls for a straight-arrow good girl and finds adjusting to more of an adult life more complicated than he expected.

programme.title: Alex Edelman: Just For Us
programme.desc: In the wake of a string of anti-Semitic threats online, comedian Alex Edelman goes straight to the source, covertly attending a meeting of white nationalists and coming face-to-face with the people behind the keyboards.

programme.title: Stevie Van Zandt: Disciple
programme.desc: Traces Van Zandt's career as a musician, activist and actor from New Jersey to stadiums around the world.

programme.title: Uncut Gems
programme.desc: A jewelry store owner and dealer to rich and famous clients places a series of high-stakes bets in the hopes of securing a huge windfall. But His lavish spending habits on gambling, and family issues cause him to become behind on his debts. So he devises a clever way to pay off his bookies and finally come out ahead all while protecting his family and business.

programme.title: Dream Scenario
programme.desc: The narrative follows a very unkempt professor named Paul Matthews. His life is quite uneventful until suddenly, his image appears in people's dreams. Soon, millions of strangers find themselves dreaming about him. The event made him an overnight sensation. However, things change when these dreams soon become nightmares for some and, later, for many.

programme.title: The Iron Claw
programme.desc: The biographical drama chronicles the rise of the four Von Erich brothers in the field of professional wrestling in the 1980s. Coached by their father Fritz Von Erich, Kevin, Kerry, David, and Mike become famous wrestling champions as they dominate the ring with countless victories. Soon, their fame turns into a curse when deadly tragedy strikes the Von Erich family.

programme.title: Notes on a Scandal
programme.desc: Judi Dench and Cate Blanchett give sensational, Oscar-nominated performances in this riveting tale of a spinster schoolteacher who discovers that a younger colleague is having an affair with a teenage student. Bill Nighy, Andrew Simpson, Phil Davis, Michael Maloney. Directed by Richard Eyre.

programme.title: Slave Play. Not a Movie. A Play
programme.desc: "Slave Play" was one of Broadway's most celebrated, genre-bending, and daring productions. Playwright Jeremy O. Harris takes viewers behind the scenes, from run-throughs to performance, as he strips down his own work and directs new actors through workshop rehearsals. As the acting students parse the text and bring meaning to the words on the page, Harris turns his critical eye to the thoughts, inspirations, and creative process that brought the play to life.

programme.title: The Souvenir
programme.desc: Set in the early 1980s, a young British film student finds herself pulled into a volatile yet passionate relationship with a mysterious man. Things begin to unfold as the man she loves appears to also be a stranger in this film about love, identity and trust.

programme.title: Gloria Bell
programme.desc: After her divorce, Gloria decides to live her life fast and loose frequenting clubs and doing whatever her heart desires. She then meets Arnold and things turn serious much faster than she anticipated. The more intimate they get, the more she struggles to fully commit, fearing the same outcome as her last relationship.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October
programme.desc: Tom Clancy's thriller about a Soviet commander heading for the U.S. coast in a missile-laden supersub, hoping to defect. But the CIA, aware that the vessel was about to embark on an evasive mission to demonstrate its ability to avoid detection, believes that the commander is insane, and that he plans to start World War III.

programme.title: Behind Enemy Lines
programme.desc: Slick visuals and a rousing script recommend this action-packed war film. When a pilot's jet is shot down over Bosnia by rebel Serbs, top-gun Chris Burnett (Owen Wilson) goes on the run in enemy territory. As opposing troops and a hired assassin swarm around Burnett, a hardened American admiral (Gene Hackman) defies NATO orders and organizes a mission to rescue him. Gabriel Macht, David Keith.

programme.title: Eye in the Sky
programme.desc: In this provocative war drama, a British colonel requests a drone strike on a group of terrorists in Nairobi. However, the situation grows more complicated when an American drone pilot discovers that a 9-year-old girl has entered the targeted area, forcing a number of military leaders and politicians to debate the best course of action.

programme.title: Music From Another Room
programme.desc: A struggling artist believes he's destined to marry the young woman whose birth he assisted when he was a child - but her quirky family and angry fiancé seem determined to foil his repeated attempts to win her heart.Jude Law, Gretchen Mol, Jennifer Tilly, Martha Plimpton, Brenda Blethyn, Bruce Jarchow, Jeremy Piven.

programme.title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
programme.desc: In this quirky meditation on art, death and high school, a misfit teen befriends a female classmate who has leukemia. As they grow closer, she helps him with his creative endeavors and forces him to confront the messiness of real life.

programme.title: Here To Climb
programme.desc: After a catastrophic injury, world-class climber Sasha DiGiulian questions her identity, dreams, and ability to return to the sport.

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: Sergio Leone's finale in the Man With No Name trilogy centers on the taciturn, enigmatic loner trying to beat his rivals, a ruthless bounty hunter and a Mexican bandit, to a cache of hidden gold.

When Adam (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) is diagnosed with cancer and given a 50-percent chance of survival, his friend Kyle (Seth Rogen) works to keep his spirits up in this heartfelt and hilarious comedy-drama.

programme.title: Minari
programme.desc: A Korean American family relocates to a small farm in Arkansas in the 1980s – to pursue their own version of the American Dream. The arrival of their irreverent grandmother disrupts the balance they try to maintain between cultural assimilation and autonomy.

programme.title: Leaving Las Vegas
programme.desc: A down-and-out alcoholic screenwriter decides to commit suicide by going on a final bender in Sin City. During his self-destructive final days, he falls in love with a prostitute.

programme.title: The Great Lillian Hall
programme.desc: As beloved Broadway star Lillian Hall pours her heart, soul, and time into preparing for her next big role, she finds herself blindsided by confusion and forgetfulness. Battling against all odds to make it to opening night, while holding on to her fading memories and identity, she must navigate a tumultuous emotional journey – balancing her desire for the spotlight and the stark demands of the real world.

programme.title: Zola
programme.desc: This comedy-drama film is inspired by the Twitter thread that went viral in 2015. Tweeting under her account handle @_zolarmoon, Zola tweets about meeting a sex worker named Stefani and how their immediate friendship led to a strange road trip. The women aim to reach Florida and earn money by dancing in various strip clubs. However, they run into several mishaps and misadventures as they travel with Stefani's male companions: her boyfriend Derrek and her pimp named X.

programme.title: Men
programme.desc: In the aftermath of a personal tragedy, Harper retreats alone to the beautiful English countryside, hoping to find a place to heal. But someone — or something — from the surrounding woods appears to be stalking her, and what begins as simmering dread becomes a fully-formed nightmare, inhabited by her darkest memories and fears.

programme.title: Our Family Wedding
programme.desc: This charming comedy follows a pair of headstrong fathers (Forest Whitaker, Carlos Mencia) as they struggle to put their personal differences aside when their son and daughter prepare to tie the knot.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October
programme.desc: Tom Clancy's thriller about a Soviet commander heading for the U.S. coast in a missile-laden supersub, hoping to defect. But the CIA, aware that the vessel was about to embark on an evasive mission to demonstrate its ability to avoid detection, believes that the commander is insane, and that he plans to start World War III.

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Jack Ryan foils an attempted assassination, thereby incurring the wrath of a maniacal Irish radical. After seemingly neutralizing the villains he decides to celebrate the occasion with his family, but then all hell breaks loose.

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: When a close friend of the president is murdered by a Colombian drug cartel, a CIA agent must tread carefully through the investigation for one reason: the friend was in league with the cartel. When an operation to kill the drug lords responsible goes south, the agent must lead the rescue on his own.

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: In the exciting third installment of the "Planet of the Apes" prequel series, simian leader Caesar seeks revenge on the humans who killed his family. In time, his vendetta threatens to ignite all-out war between the two species.

programme.title: Meg 2: The Trench
programme.desc: Research team leader Jonas Taylor and his team encounter newly discovered megalodons on their recent expedition. Nicknamed the meg, what they thought were extinct giant sharks resurfaced anew as the team runs afoul of a shady mining operation. In the ensuing clash, a new shark attacks. This installment is a sequel to the 2018 sci-fi action film.

programme.title: After Earth
programme.desc: In this epic sci-fi adventure set in the distant future, a father and son crash-land their spaceship on a desolate planet Earth. Later, the young boy must embark on a treacherous journey into hostile territory in order to locate their rescue beacon and save his dad's life.
